qdes: \text{If A's salary is 25\% less than B's salary, by how much percent is B's salary more than A's?}
\text{Find the single discount in percentage which is equivalent to two successive discounts of 25\% and 20\% given for an article.}
\begin{array}{l} \text{If the numerator of a fraction is increased by 50\% and the denominator is decreased by 20\% then it becomes } \frac{3}{5}, \\  \text{find the original fraction.} \end{array}

\begin{array}{l} \text{In a school, 30\% of the students play chess, 60\% play cricket and 15\% play both chess and cricket.} \\ \text{If 99 students do not play any of these games, find the number of students who play only chess.}\end{array}
\text{A man sold an article for Rs. 4,500 and gained 10\%. Find the cost price of the article}
\text{A man sold an article for Rs. 5400 and suffered a loss of 10\%. At what price should he sell it to have a profit of 20\%?}

\begin{array}{l} \text{A person saves 10\% of his income. If his income is increased by 20\% and he saves 20\% of his new income,} \\ \text{then what is the percentage increase in his saving?} \end{array}
\text{Kuralmathi bought a raincoat and saved }₹25\text{ with discount of 20\%, what was the original price of the raincoat?}
\begin{array}{l}\text{The population of a town is increasing at the rate of 6\% p.a. It was 238765 in the year 2018.} \\ \text{Find the population in the year 2016.} \end{array}
\text{Convert }\frac{7}{4}\text{ into percentage.}
\text{By selling a flower pot for Rs. 528, a woman gains 20\%. At what price should she sell it to gain 25\%?}
\text{What is 25\% of 30\% of 400?}
\text{If } x \% \text{ of 600 is 450 then, find the value of } x .
\text{If 20\% of A = B and 40\% of B = C then find 60\% (A + B)}
